content:
USER: [{'tool_use_id': 'toolu_01XFNbZP3E4CShY5fjoZQxhy', 'type': 'tool_result', 'content': "   240→
   241→```sql
   242→-- Example: Find memories about AI ethics
   243→SELECT content, namespace, created_at
   244→FROM memories_embedding
   245→WHERE namespace = 'core_identity'
   246→ORDER BY embedding <=> ai.ollama_embed('qwen3-embedding:4b', 'AI ethics and user privacy')
   247→LIMIT 10;
   248→```
   249→
   250→**Method B: Text Search (Exact Matches)**
   251→Use when you need exact phrases, commands, or specific quotes.
   252→
   253→```sql
   254→-- Example: Find when we discussed Facebook API
   255→SELECT content, namespace, created_at
   256→FROM memories
   257→WHERE content ILIKE '%Facebook API%'
   258→  AND namespace = 'scripty'
   259→ORDER BY created_at DESC
   260→LIMIT 20;
   261→```
   262→
   263→**Method C: Namespace Filtering (Category-Specific)**
   264→Use when you know which category contains what you need.
   265→
   266→```sql
   267→-- Example: Get all job applications from this month
   268→SELECT content, created_at
   269→FROM memories

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>
"}]
